intro: Anthriscus keniensis f. gracilis, commonly known as the slender Kenyan cow parsley, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, slender stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to Kenya and thrives in moist, temperate climates. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and naturalized areas.
